sentence.Network_en: The payee of the cheque must endorse the cheque.
sentence.Network_cn: 领款人必须在支票上背书。

sentence.Network_en: The plan does not explicitly endorse the private ownership of land.
sentence.Network_cn: 该计划没有明确地支持土地私有制.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 15th cent. (in the sense 'write on the back of'; formerly also as indorse): from medieval Latin indorsare, from Latin in- 'in, on' + dorsum 'back'

entry.def: If you endorse someone or something, you say publicly that you support or approve of them.

example.ex: I can endorse their opinion wholeheartedly.
example.tran: 我可以全力支持他们的意见。

example.ex: ...policies agreed by the Labour Party and endorsed by the electorate.
example.tran: 得到工党赞同并受选民支持的政策

entry.tran: 在（驾驶执照）上注明违章
entry.def: If someone's driving licence is endorsed, an official record is made on it that they have been found guilty of a driving offence.

example.ex: For failing to report the accident, his licence was endorsed...
example.tran: 由于发生事故未能报告，他的驾驶执照被注明违章。

example.ex: He also had his licence endorsed with eight penalty points.
example.tran: 他的驾驶执照也被扣了8分。

entry.def: When you endorse a cheque, you write your name on the back of it so that it can be paid into someone's bank account.

example.ex: The payee of the cheque must endorse the cheque.
example.tran: 领款人必须在支票上背书。

entry.def: If you endorse a product or company, you appear in advertisements for it.

example.ex: The twins endorsed a line of household cleaning products.
example.tran: 那对双胞胎为一系列家用清洁产品做广告。

means.word_mean: 2. give support or one's approval to;
3. guarantee as meeting a certain standard;

auth_sentence.content: Growing numbers of Republicans endorse gay marriage as well.
auth_sentence.res_content: Growing numbers of Republicans endorse gay marriage as well.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Growing numbers of Republicans endorse gay marriage as well.

auth_sentence.content: In exchange, Pickens would publicly endorse the bill.
auth_sentence.res_content: In exchange, Pickens would publicly endorse the bill.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: In exchange, Pickens would publicly endorse the bill.

auth_sentence.content: The blind sheik declined to endorse the venture.
auth_sentence.res_content: The blind sheik declined to endorse the venture.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The blind sheik declined to endorse the venture.

Sentence.sentence: For example, men who endorse traditional masculine norms report lower relationship satisfaction, as do their female partners.

means.word_mean: <商>在(尤指支票的)背面签字;背书
赞同,认可,支持(意见,活动,某人等)

sentences.en: No one is foolish enough to endorse it.
sentences.cn: 没有哪个人会傻得赞成它。

sentences.en: The committee endorsed an initiative by the chairman to enter discussion about a possible merger.
sentences.cn: 委员会通过了主席提出的新方案，开始就可能进行的并购进行讨论。

sentences.en: The government has broadly endorsed a research paper proposing new educational targets for 14-year-olds.
sentences.cn: 政府基本上支持建议对14 岁少年实行新教育目标的研究报告。

sentences.en: The plan does not explicitly endorse the private ownership of land.
sentences.cn: 该计划没有明确地支持土地私有制。
